nodes.title: Stability AI
nodes.desc: A cutting-edge field that combines artificial intelligence, machine learning, and control theory to create stable and efficient systems. [More Info](https://www.stability.ai/)

nodes.title: Artificial Intelligence
nodes.desc: The development of computer systems that can perform tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as visual perception, speech recognition, and decision-making. [More Info](https://www.ibm.com/cloud/learn/ai)

nodes.title: Python
nodes.desc: A popular programming language used in machine learning and artificial intelligence. [More Info](https://www.python.org/)

nodes.title: TensorFlow
nodes.desc: A popular open-source machine learning framework developed by Google. [More Info](https://www.tensorflow.org/)

nodes.title: Keras
nodes.desc: A high-level neural networks API that can run on top of TensorFlow or Theano. [More Info](https://www.keras.io/)

nodes.title: Stability Analysis
nodes.desc: The study of the stability of systems, often using techniques from control theory and optimization. [More Info](https://www.stabilityanalysis.org/)

nodes.title: Robust Control
nodes.desc: A branch of control theory that deals with the design of control systems that can withstand uncertainty and disturbances. [More Info](https://www.robustcontrol.org/)

nodes.title: Model Predictive Control
nodes.desc: A type of control theory that uses models to predict the future behavior of a system and optimize its performance. [More Info](https://www.mpc.org/)

nodes.title: Machine Learning
nodes.desc: A subset of artificial intelligence that involves the use of algorithms and statistical models to enable machines to perform a specific task without using explicit instructions. [More Info](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/machine-learning)

nodes.title: Control Theory
nodes.desc: A branch of mathematics that deals with the control and optimization of systems, often using feedback loops to achieve stability. [More Info](https://www.control.lth.se/)

nodes.title: Deep Learning
nodes.desc: A type of machine learning that uses neural networks with multiple layers to analyze data, often used in image and speech recognition. [More Info](https://www.deeplearning.ai/)

nodes.title: Reinforcement Learning
nodes.desc: A type of machine learning that involves training agents to take actions in an environment to maximize a reward signal. [More Info](https://www.reinforcementlearning.org/)

nodes.title: Optimization
nodes.desc: The process of finding the best solution among a set of possible solutions, often used in machine learning and control theory. [More Info](https://www.optimization.org/)

nodes.title: Linear Algebra
nodes.desc: A branch of mathematics that deals with the study of linear equations, vector spaces, and linear transformations. [More Info](https://www.linearalgebra.org/)

nodes.title: Calculus
nodes.desc: A branch of mathematics that deals with the study of continuous change, often used in optimization and control theory. [More Info](https://www.calculus.org/)

nodes.title: Differential Equations
nodes.desc: Equations that describe how a quantity changes over time or space, often used in control theory and optimization. [More Info](https://www.diffeq.org/)
